intro: Acioa scabrifolia, commonly known as the rough-leaved acioa, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
